**Jokers:**
1. Blue Joker - +106 Chips (currently +106 based on deck size)
2. Showman - Joker/Tarot/Planet/Spectral cards may appear multiple times
3. Troubadour - +2 hand size, -1 hand each round
4. Card Sharp - X3 Mult if played poker hand has already been played this round
5. Space Joker - 1 in 4 chance to upgrade level of played poker hand

**Shop Offerings:**
Cards:
1. Astronomer - All Planet cards and Celestial Packs in the shop are free ($8)
2. Square Joker - +4 Chips per 4-card hand ($4)

Boosters:
1. Jumbo Celestial Pack - Choose 1 of 5 Planet cards ($6)
2. Jumbo Standard Pack - Choose 1 of 5 Playing cards ($6)

Vouchers:
1. Seed Money - Raise interest cap to $10 ($10)

Reroll Cost: $5

**Strategy Analysis:**

Looking at my recent performance:
- Full House is my primary winning hand (Level 7 now, 190 base chips, 16 base mult)
- I've played it 9 times total
- Card Sharp has been incredibly valuable - it gives X3 mult when I play the same hand type twice
- Blue Joker is strong with +106 chips currently

**What should I buy?**

1. **Astronomer ($8)** - This would make Planet cards and Celestial Packs free. I have $13, so I could buy this and then get free planet cards to level up hands. However, I'd need to see if there are planet cards available after buying it, or I'd need to reroll.


2. **Square Joker ($4)** - Gives +4 chips only on 4-card hands, but Troubadour's +2 hand size means I'm playing 5-card hands most of the time for Full House. Not a strong fit for my current strategy.
3. **Jumbo Celestial Pack ($6)** - Could upgrade a hand, but becomes free if I grab Astronomer first, making this a better purchase after.
4. **Seed Money ($10)** - Doubles my interest cap, but hand leveling feels more impactful right now than banking extra money.

The clearest path forward is buying Astronomer for $8, leaving me with $5. That makes the Celestial Pack free, so I can immediately level up Full House without spending anything extra. I'd still have $5 remaining after both purchases. This combo gives me the strongest possible hand for the Boss Blind without overextending my budget. My joker slots are maxed at 5/5, so I can't add more without selling existing ones—upgrading my hands is the better investment at this point.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
